books.title: Manalive
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: An eccentric man brings chaos and happiness to a house of litigious lodgers.

books.title: The Coral Island
books.author: R. M. Ballantyne
books.summary: Three shipwrecked youths encounter delights and dangers as they attempt to escape their uninhabited tropical island paradise.

books.title: The Enormous Room
books.author: E. E. Cummings
books.summary: E. E. Cummings describes the experiences of his and his fellow inmates’ imprisonment during World War I.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: The Story of the Treasure Seekers
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Six siblings search for treasure in order to restore their lost family fortune.

books.title: Leave It to Psmith
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Psmith inveigles himself into Blandings Castle to help out a friend and to pursue love.

books.title: Pericles
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A Tyrian prince flees after he discovers a terrible secret.

books.title: Master Flea
books.author: E. T. A. Hoffmann
books.summary: A gentleman bachelor gains an epic advantage of tiny proportions in this allegorical, Romantic, fairy-tale novel.

books.title: The Good Soldier
books.author: Ford Madox Ford
books.summary: The friendship between two well-heeled couples is a veneer over darker truths.

books.title: Brood of the Witch-Queen
books.author: Sax Rohmer
books.summary: A father and son duo investigate a man who is wielding ancient Egyptian magic.

books.title: A Negro Explorer at the North Pole
books.author: Matthew Henson
books.summary: The self-told story of the black man who accompanied Robert Peary during the first trip to the North Pole.

books.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective investigates a variety of intriguing cases in the first Holmes short story collection.

books.title: Heretics
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: A collection of essays in which G. K. Chesterton debates the intellectuals of his day on a range of topics.

books.title: The Theory of the Leisure Class
books.author: Thorstein Veblen
books.summary: Veblen outlines his theory of social stratification in an industrialized society, the paradoxical elevation of the leisure class, and conspicuous consumption.

books.title: The Canterbury Tales
books.author: Geoffrey Chaucer
books.summary: A group of pilgrims trade tales as they travel through medieval England.

books.title: Captain Jinks, Hero
books.author: Ernest Howard Crosby
books.summary: A jingoistic military officer embarks on a tragicomic quest to become a “perfect soldier.”

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: A collection of E. M. Forster’s short stories, ordered by date of their original publication.

books.title: The Mind of Mr. J. G. Reeder
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A meek and unassuming employee at the Department of Public Prosecutions exercises his remarkable skills to solve puzzling crimes.

books.title: Religion and the Rise of Capitalism
books.author: R. H. Tawney
books.summary: A tracing of the development of religious thought from the Middle Ages to the dawn of the Industrial Revolution.

books.title: The Worst Journey in the World
books.author: Apsley Cherry-Garrard
books.summary: The travelogue of a member of Robert Scott’s ill-fated Antarctic expedition of 1910.
